page.title: 09ROADWORKS ON THE M1 MOTORWAY
page.content: In{June}and{July 1985}there were major roadworks taking place on the motorway between{Catcliffe}and{ {Tinsley. }The rush-hour traffic was often slowed in{jams,}but these were better than having the motorway closed completely. The{major repairs}were to the{ {southbound}lanes. Only the third lane was left open but more vehicles travelling{south}were allowed to cross into the{northbound}carriageway and use the third lane there. This meant that traffic travelling{north}was left using the{hard shoulder and slow lane. Lines of{red and white 'cones'} separated the traffic moving in opposite directions. A temporary speed limit of{50 miles {per hour}was advised but many cars appeared to take no notice of it!
